listing.description: No 7 Mackay HouseThree-bedroom house over three levels with study, terrace and balconyWhite Lion PlaceLocated on Portsmouth Road, in the heart of Cobham, White Lion Place is an exclusive collection of 30 newly-built and converted houses, apartments and duplexes, designed with retirement in mind.The six converted properties are the result of Beechcroft’s careful conversion of a Grade II listed building that played a major role in Cobham’s history. The former White Lion was the first stop on the stagecoach route from London to Portsmouth and, whilst the elevations are mainly 18th century, parts of this historic building date back to the 16th century.The 24 newly built homes, set in three buildings – Barley House, Mackay House and The Malthouse include a collection of two, three and four-bedroom apartments and duplexes along with a three-bedroom house. Each unique new home provides plenty of generously-proportioned living space and all have outside space in the form of private gardens, terraces, balconies, Juliette balconies or roof terraces. All the stylish, energy-efficient homes at White Lion Place have been designed to reflect the grandeur of the listed building and historical relevance of the site and each features the contemporary, high quality specification that is a hallmark of all Beechcroft properties.

listing.description: A beautifully presented freehold mews house in a private road which has security gate access only. Set over three floors the property benefits from three bedrooms, double reception, separate kitchen, bathroom, guest cloakroom, private patio to the rear and private garage integral to the house. The garage has the potential to be converted to extend the ground floor.The property is located .Close to Maida Vale and Westbourne Park underground transport links, as well as several bus routes. Approx. 10 minutes walking distance are the shops and cafes at Maida Vale. Both Portebello Road and Queens Park are within approx. 15 minutes. listing.description: A lovely four double bedroom detached family home situated in a popular location within easy access of both Weybridge and Walton On Thames. We feel this well presented and well-proportioned property features spacious accommodation comprising dual aspect lounge with feature fireplace, fantastic fitted kitchen which opens up to the conservatory overlooking the private enclosed and well maintained Southerly aspect rear garden.The property also benefits a separate dining room, study, four double bedrooms with ensuite shower room to the master, family bathroom, downstairs W/C, driveway parking for several vehicles, gas central heating and double glazed windows.The property is located within the ever popular Oatlands area which in our opinion is conveniently situated between Weybridge and Walton On Thames which both provide a good selection of shops, restaurants and other amenities. Walton On Thames mainline train station is approximately 15 minutes’ walk and provides a fast and regular service to London Waterloo.Internal viewings are highly recommended to fully appreciate this superb family home.

listing.description: Sterling are delighted to offer to the market the rare opportunity to acquire this individual and stunning brick and flint detached family home.Occupying a set back position and a mature plot the property offers exceptionally versatile accommodation arranged over two floors. listing.short_description:
Sterling are delighted to offer to the market the rare opportunity to acquire this individual and stunning brick and flint detached family home. Occupying a set back position and a mature plot the property offers exceptionally versatile accommodation arranged over two floors. The living accommodation comprises formal living room with wood burning stove, open plan kitchen/breakfast room, family room and garden room. There are four double bedrooms and a family bathroom. The master bedroom suite occupies the whole first floor and has the benefit of fitted wardrobes and a stunning en suite master bathroom. Externally there is ample parking via a private driveway and a stunning garden which wraps around the property and offers a very private outlook to all aspects. There is also a detached garden office/storage outbuilding.

The Situation

Rucklers Lane is located on the outskirts of Kings Langley and Apsley and is regarded as one of the more sought after locations within Kings Langley and WD4. Situated on the southern edge of the Chiltern Hills and approximately 20 miles from the centre of London, Kings Langley is the perfect location for those seeking an area with excellent road and rail links yet the peace and tranquility of a traditional Hertfordshire village. Kings Langley is split between the two local authorities of Dacorum and Three Rivers.

There is a mainline train station to the east of the village serves London Euston in approximately 30 minutes and the M25 is approximately 1.5 miles from the village centre and gives excellent access to central London, a host of international airports and further road links to the north.

listing.description: A truly magnificent four bedroom Edwardian home with fireplaces in galore. Situated in one, if not the most sought after locations, Milestone Road is well positioned for The Triangles amenities, local Schools and Crystal Palace Station. Offering an abundance of period features, design and character throughout, rarely is such a charming house available on the market.This period property has been beautifully designed and carefully presented throughout by its current owner to accentuate its remarkable qualities. The vibrant red door leads you into a grand entrance with refurbished staircase, setting the scene for the stunning accommodation.The lounge has a bright bay area with original refurbished wooden framed windows, exposed wooden flooring and gorgeous decorative cornicing. Measuring 16'5 x 15' into the bay, this room offers plenty of space for the family.The second and third reception rooms interconnect making it an ideal area for dining and entertaining. Fireplaces at either end and access to the higher tier of the garden, this room is full of natural light. The separate kitchen is stocked with all of the necessary appliances with a solid wooden worktop and vaulted ceiling featuring a Velux window.The basement has to be seen to be fully appreciated. The rooms run under the entire house, subject to planning and a creative mind, this space could be fully utilised to create something special. The current owner uses the area for storage with a utility area and direct access to the garden.Upstairs you are greeted with a spacious landing. All three bedrooms on the first floor are doubles. The stylish master bedroom measures 15'3 x 14' with a charming bay area, sash windows and built in wardrobes The master bedroom also has a gorgeous en-suite that is finished in glass tiles to the walls and granite flooring.The top floor is currently used as a design studio, this versatile room could be used in a variety of ways. Velux windows and two Juliet balconies flood the room with natural light. Providing un-restricted views of the surrounding area, the outlook is breathtaking.Outside, the garden features mature shrubs and a private outlook. With large patio areas, this is really an area that everyone can enjoy.The Crystal Palace Triangle is on your doorstep with its vast array of facilities, including bakeries, boutiques, coffee shops and restaurants with flavours from around the world. Crystal Palace Station is 0.4 miles away offering access to London Victoria & London Bridge.Overall this really is a truly charming property with bags of space, potential and period features. To view this very special property call iMove today!
listing.short_description: 4 bedroom semi-detached house internally measuring over 2800sqft! 3 reception rooms and huge basement. Accommodation over 4 floors, master bedroom with en-suite, Period features in abundance and located on milestone road. Call iMove for your appointment.

listing.description: Arranged over three floors, this modern townhouse provides flexible living accommodation as well as the potential to re-configure and add value. The internal space comprises an entrance hall, dining room with double sliding doors to the rear garden, kitchen, downstairs WC and an integrated garage on the ground floor, a great size reception room over looking the rear garden and communal gardens, master bedroom with Jack & Jill style bathroom on the first floor, and a double bedroom with an en suite shower room with two further bedrooms and another bathroom on the second floor. The property further benefits from a well maintained, fully enclosed rear garden and a wonderful, gated communal garden with a beautiful Willow tree as the centrepiece and a tennis court exclusively for the fifteen residences in the development.Westover Road is one of Wandsworth's most prestigious addresses and is an exceptionally quiet, residential street moments from Wandsworth Common. Clapham Junction is within walking distance which provides direct trains into Waterloo in just ten minutes and Gatwick Airport in half an hour. The location also provides easy access to the A3/M25 for the motorist as well as multiple bus routes in and out of Central London. Wandsworth Town Centre also boasts fantastic shopping and leisure facilities within the expanding Southside Shopping Centre.Wandsworth is also renowned for its excellent schooling from both state and private schools.

With its array of shops and restaurants just moments away, and the supermarkets and excellent O2 centre facilities on the Finchley Road. listing.description: A rare and unique early 18th century farmhouse occupying a central position within Somerton yet backing on to open countryside overlooking its own grounds. In all amounting to approximately 4.5 acres including the Mill Stream and Ringers Well.SummarySunhouse Farm is a beautiful Grade II listed farmhouse dating we believe from the early 18th century. Occupying this wonderful elevated situation, the juxtaposition between town and country is quite unique being close to the centre of Somerton however overlooking its own grounds of approximately 4.5 acres with country views across the Mill Stream and woodland beyond. The property is constructed of Blue Lias elevations under a pitched double roman tiled roof and offers more than 3500 sq ft of living space. The house requires some general updating and improvements however offers excellent opportunities, due to the properties layout and arrangement of services it could easily provide a self contained annex or be divided into two separate dwellings subject to the usual approval. The grounds are made up of several paddocks and woodland, the Mill Stream meanders along the bottom of the shallow valley with a pond and stone arched foot bridge. The ancient Ringers Well is situated to the west with its original stone steps and spring. Described as 'a spring of fine water' and reputed to posses 'medicinal properties' A public footpath once led to the spring for the people of Somerton to access however was closed in 1904 by G.W.RAmenitiesSomerton was the ancient Capital of Wessex in the 8th century and a former market town. It then later became the County town of Somerset in the 13th/14th Century. There is a good level of amenities including shops, bank, library, doctor and dentist surgeries, there are also several public houses, restaurants, churches and primary schools within the town. The local area has some of the best schools in the country including Millfield, Wells Cathedral School, Downside, All Hallows and the Kings Bruton. A more comprehensive range of amenities can be found in Bath, Bristol, Street or the County town of Taunton to the west and Yeovil to the south. The mainline railway stations are located in Castle Cary, Yeovil and Taunton. The property is also well served by the A303 linking both central London and the South West, the M5 can be joined at junction 23.ServicesMains water, electricity, gas and drainage are all connected. A vehicular gravelled drive and gate give access to a block outbuilding and the paddocks. The land totals approximately 4.5 acres and is situated to the south and west of the house, made up of two large meadows and some woodland. The Mill Stream dissects the grounds at the bottom a shallow valley with a pretty arched stone foot bridge. The bottom meadow sweeps around to the west and has vehicular access from Station Path.

listing.description: A detached 1920's built family home, offering well-presented three storey, five bedrooms, two bath/shower room, four reception room accommodation, extending to approx. 2723sq ft., conveniently situated within a very short walk to Woking centre and station. Since originally being built the house has been substantially extended and successfully remodelled. The ground floor includes an impressive open plan kitchen/breakfast room with central island unit and numerous integrated appliances. The breakfast area has room for a large dining table and is perfectly proportioned as a formal dining room, if required. There is a large living room with access to the rear garden, playroom/study, family room and a further reception room, also, as required. The utility room and cloakroom complete the accommodation on this floor. On the first floor are three double bedrooms, master bedroom with spacious en-suite shower room, plus the four piece family bathroom with roll top bath. The second floor has the further two bedrooms, a walk in wardrobe and plenty of eaves storage. All windows are upvc double glazed and heating is gas fired to radiators. Outside, there is parking for multiple vehicles and a rear garden that features extensive lawn and timber decking. The aforementioned situation is literally just outside the town centre and therefore the shortest of walks. Offered to the market with no onward chain, this property truly is a must view!Stunning Five Bedroom Detached HouseRecently RefurbishedFour Reception RoomStylish Kitchen/Breakfast RoomMaster Bedroom With En-Suite Shower RoomMature Private GardenOff-Street ParkingShort Walk To the Town CentreNo onward chain

listing.letting_fees:
Information for new / prospective tenants


As an ARLA registered agent, we recognise the importance of fairness in relation to tenants fees, and therefore we keep these charges to a minimum.

Q1: How much will I be expected to pay as a holding deposit to reserve a property?
A: (a) £500.00 deposit for a rental agreed at £500pw or less
(b) £750.00 deposit for a rental agreed over £500pw

Q2: What payments / details are required, prior to moving into a property?
A: (a) Credit/ Reference check via a Referencing company: £ 25.00 plus v.A.T (per tenant)

(b) Administration fees will apply:-
(1) Studio/1 Bedroom : £200.00 plus v.A.T.
(2) 2 Bedrooms+ : £300.00 plus v.A.T.

(c) Security deposit: 6 weeks’ rent (see Q3)

(d) The first calendar month’s rent (rent per week x 52 / 12)

(e) Signed declaration form. In accordance with the Data Protection
act, Each tenant will be required to sign an attached declaration
provided by our appointed referencing agency, homelet, for the
purposes of obtaining necessary references and credit checks.

(f) Passport copy from each tenant

Q3: What security deposit should I expect to pay?
Subject to contract and acceptable references an equivalent of 6 weeks rent will be required as a deposit before possession of the property is given and in most circumstances upon signing the tenancy agreement. This will be registered in a government backed tenancy deposit scheme and a certificate provided.

In some circumstances, such as tenants with pets or an adverse credit history a higher deposit may be requested to be held for the duration of the tenancy.

Q4: How much will I be charged if I fail the credit check?
A: The holding deposit will be refunded, less the cost of the credit/reference check.

Q5: How much will I be charged if the landlord withdraws from the letting of the property?
A: The holding deposit will be refunded, less the cost of the credit/reference check.

Q6: How much will I be charged if I withdraw from the letting of the property?
A: (a) 1 weeks rent ( if the letting was agreed less than 2 weeks prior to withdrawing) or
2 weeks rent (if the letting was agreed 2 weeks or more, prior to withdrawing)

(b) An Administration charge of £100.00 plus v.A.T.

(c) Credit /reference check fee: £25.00 plus v.A.T. (per tenant)
(d) The cost of any purchases made at your specific request

Q7. Are there any charges during the tenancy?
A. Replacement / Additional tenants will be expected to pay the following:-
(a) Credit/ Reference check
via a Referencing company: £ 25.00 plus v.A.T (per tenant)

(b) An administration charge including
Drawing up of Deed of Assignment;
Re-registering the Tenants deposit;
and providing a new
certificate: £ 75.00 plus v.A.T (per tenant)

listing.letting_fees:
Fees apply

Tenant Fees & Charges

Mandatory charges associated with the setting up of your tenancy

There are various fees and charges associated with renting a property that you should be aware of when considering making an offer on a property. More detailed information is available upon request.

(Where not payable you will be advised accordingly)

Preliminary Charge - 42% Inc. VAT of the first months rent or £420 Inc. VAT, whichever is the greater.
This charge all inclusive charge covers the tenancy agreement, referencing and the check-in. It is not collected until the landlord has, subject-to-contact and references, accepted your offer. If the tenancy does not proceed for whatever reason we will refund a proportionate amount of the charge based on work undertaken and costs incurred.

Short Let Fee – From £440 (Inc. VAT)†

This charge applies to short term lettings only and covers: The cost of preparing an Agreement; an inventory check-in and an end of tenancy clean (excluding carpets).

Other funds you should allow for

Payment of Intent – To be agreed with you

We may require a payment of intent as confirmation of your intent to proceed with the proposed tenancy. This will be put towards your first rental payment and will only be refunded if our client elects not to proceed. Payment of this sum does not constitute the granting of a tenancy.

Rent in Advance – 1 Month

You will usually be required to pay 1 months rent in advance.

Deposit – Equivalent to 6 weeks rent

The deposit is held to protect your landlord from you not meeting your obligations under the terms of the tenancy.

Stamp Duty Land Tax

This tax is payable on tenancies where the rent exceeds £125,000.

Charges if you terminate your tenancy Change of Sharer - £420 Inc. VAT

This charge applies when you wish to replace a named tenant with another tenant part way through your tenancy and your landlord has agreed to the change. Please note that the replacement tenant will be charged separately for referencing in the sum of £54 Inc. VAT each.

Deed of Surrender - £75 Inc. VAT

This charge applies to preparation of documentation where, at your request, the landlord has agreed to release you from the tenancy early.

Charges if you renew your tenancy

Memorandum of Renewal - £90 Inc. VAT

This charge covers the cost of preparing a basic document to confirm details of any renewal.

Renewal Tenancy Agreement - £150 Inc. VAT

This charge covers the cost of preparing a more extensive renewal document where changes to the terms agreed dictate.

Potential charges at the end of your tenancy

Future Landlord Reference - £30 Inc. VAT

This charge applies when you ask us to provide a reference to a future landlord.

† Based on a 2 bedroom property in London.
listing.description: The White Cottage is an immaculately presented, Victorian locally listed family home, set in the popular Meadvale area which is a short distance from Reigate town centre. The property has a magnificent light and spacious hallway, family room, study, dual aspect sitting room and a beautifully presented kitchen and dining room with double doors to a courtyard area. On the first floor is a dual aspect master bedroom with ensuite shower room, bedroom two with ensuite shower room, three further bedrooms and a family bathroom.To the rear is a pretty courtyard with steps to an attractive generous lawn area enclosed by fencing and mature trees and shrubs, there is a feature decked area with pergola, a summer house and children’s play house. To the front is off road parking for several vehicles, a small lawn area with mature trees.SituationThe property is situated just over 1 mile to the south of Reigate town centre with its comprehensive range of shopping, social, recreational and educational amenities. Train services are available from Reigate, Redhill (just 1 mile distant with a 30 minute service to London) and Gatwick. The M25 is readily accessible at Junction 8 (Reigate Hill) and Gatwick, approximately 8 miles to the south, is accessible via the A217. Reigate has a selection of popular schools including Dunottar and Reigate Grammar.Additional InformationReigate and Banstead Borough CouncilTel: Tax Band G

listing.description: New to the market for the first time in over 30 years. A semi detached double fronted six bedroom, four reception house which is sadly now in need of major updating. Offering 2214sqft/206sqm of floor space with a 58ft/17m rear garden and off street parking for at least three cars. Accommodation is arranged as follows, entrance hall, four receptions rooms, kitchen and shower room on the ground floor, whilst the first floor comprises, landing, five bedrooms, bathroom and separate WC. The top floor provides a dormer loft conversion bedroom six. There is still plenty of scope to further improve and extend this property if desired. Located on the corner of Bowes Road and Foster Road within the very popular and in demand Goldsmith Estate, the property has both East Acton Central Line and Acton Central Overground Stations within easy reach. The property is available immediately and to buy with no onward chain.

listing.description: This beautifully presented, three bedroom late Victorian house is located away from the hustle and bustle of the main streets yet still close to all the local shops, restaurants and excellent transport facilities. With two primary schools, Clapham Junction rail hub and Clapham Common all being with half a mile the house is well suited to a family. Inside there are three bright, double bedrooms and a smart family bathroom on the first floor. On the ground floor there is a guest WC and plenty of room for entertainment and relaxation in the spacious double reception room which has solid wood floors and leads out to an easy to maintain South Westerly facing patio garden which can also be accessed from the kitchen breakfast room. The loft has not yet been converted therefore offering extra storage space or an opportunity to add space and value. The property further benefits from double glazing with attractive wooden shutters and solid wood flooring.Reception Room - 14'9 x 11'6(4.50m x 3.51m)Dining Room - 11'8 x 9'10(3.56m x 3.00m)Kitchen - 14'9 x 9'10(4.50m x 3.00m)Garden - 17'1 x 15'5(5.21m x 4.70m)Bedroom One - 13'11 x 12'0(4.24m x 3.66m)Bedroom Two - 11'10 x 8'2(3.61m x 2.49m)Bedroom Three - 9'10 x 9'10(3.00m x 3.00m)

listing.description: The Coach House as the name would suggest was the original Coach House to the neighbouring property; converted a number of years ago and extended to form a detached house. The property is constructed of brick under a slate roof sits in a private position with a stunning rural outlook across gardens down to the river Stour and countryside with the Cotswold escarpment beyond. The accommodation offers a flexible arrangement of living with a central hall off which leads the drawing room with a large conservatory, affording the best possible views of the garden and setting. Also off the hall is the fitted kitchen, pantry cupboard, utility and cloakroom. The Dining room off which access is provided to the ground floor bedroom with fitted cupboards and an en-suite bathroom with bath and separate shower. To the first floor there are two double bedrooms looking to the South, a family bathroom, a single bedroom through which you gain access to a further bathroom with a large study beyond, these three rooms would make an excellent master bedroom suite.SituationAlderminster is a charming English village located just four miles south of Stratford-upon-Avon. Set in the countryside, the village has a thriving community and award winning pub/restaurant. Stratford –upon-Avon is renowned as the region’s cultural centre and is the home of the Royal Shakespeare Company. The town has a wide variety of shopping and leisure facilities. There are a great many quality restaurants, public houses and dining pubs with excellent reputations all within walking distance. Warwick and Leamington are also nearby and provide further facilities and schooling. There are state, private and grammar schools in the area to suit most requirements. Stratford-upon-Avon has many opportunities for boating, fishing and rowing, together with a link to the canal network. The town has a racecourse and golf course. The M40, junction 15, is seven miles away and provides access to Birmingham to the North, London to the south and the National Motorway Network.Stratford-upon-Avon – 5 milesBanbury - 18 milesBirmingham International Airport – 31 miles Warwick Parkway Train Station – 14 miles (Trains to London Marylebone 115 mins)(All distances and times are approximate)OutsideThe gravel drive leads to a parking area in front of the property. Immediately to the rear is a extensive paved terrace with the extensive mature gardens which are a particular feature of the property with the lawn running down to a Yew hedge and ha-ha wall beyond which is the River Stour. Adjacent to the lower lawn is a charming open fronted summer house constructed in a boat-house style. Beyond the River Stour is open country with a back drop of the Cotswolds. There are various outbuildings constructed of brick which make ideal garden stores.Additional InformationPostcode – CV37 8NYServices – All mains services are connected to the propertyLocal Authority – Stratford on Avon District Council – Council Tax Band – Band GFixtures and Fittings – Only those items mentioned in the particulars are included in the sale. All other items are specifically excluded but may be available by separate negotiation.Tenure – FreeholdViewing – by appointment with sole agents Hamptons International
listing.short_description: A converted four bedroom coach house in an ideal village location.

listing.description: Ready to change your life? Calling all who are ready to check out of the rat race and want to fulfill their dream of Country living (in Greater London!) This near 15 acre small holding farm will intrigue and impress you in equal measure.Currently a plant nursery with facilities in situ to continue the trade, the property additionally has equestrian facilities (stabling, fields and riding arena) and also comes with several outbuildings which are large enough to store farm machinery. There are some current usage restrictions but the options are still vast. The land contains a handsome residential three bedroom semi-detached cottage with private garden and private entrance which potentially could be extended to a more substantial property (stpp). Lastly, due to its size and positioning, the land has several access points from two hard standing roads which increases usability and access is immediate to the public bridlepath.Local towns include Wallington, Carshalton and Banstead with Croydon and Kingston a little further on in either direction. The M25 is circa 20 minutes drive away, Gatwick Airport 40 minutes away and trains into London and onward further South are available from the local towns. The area is affluent and sought after and offers suburban London living with the hallmarks of Surrey.A rare opportunity which needs to be considered fully before committing to view.Nb. The land and its use does contain covenants and restrictions. Please visit Fine and Country Cheam to view the various documents relating to this property.Nb. The land plan provides an indication of the location and the final plot is to be agreed.Three Bedroom CottageStablesRiding ArenaGrazing FieldsNumerous Out BuildingsSeveral Access PointsMapsImportant note to purchasers:We endeavour to make our sales particulars accurate and reliable, however, they do not constitute or form part of an offer or any contract and none is to be relied upon as statements of representation or fact. Any services, systems and appliances listed in this specification have not been tested by us and no guarantee as to their operating ability or efficiency is given. All measurements have been taken as a guide to prospective buyers only, and are not precise. Please be advised that some of the particulars may be awaiting vendor approval. If you require clarification or further information on any points, please contact us, especially if you are traveling some distance to view. Fixtures and fittings other than those mentioned are to be agreed with the seller./1

It has a vibrant centre with excellent shopping facilities, cafes, bars and restaurants, along with good schools and further education facilities together with fine sports, leisure and entertainment facilities. listing.description: SummaryA stunning detached property, situated on a large plot in the sought after area of Thorpe Road in Longthorpe. The property has been well maintained and improved by the current owners and has a spacious and contemporary feel throughout whilst retaining original features...DescriptionA stunning detached property, situated on a large plot in the sought after area of Thorpe Road in Longthorpe. The property has been well maintained and improved by the current owners and has a spacious and contemporary feel throughout whilst retaining original features including stone fireplaces and high ceilings. The property briefly comprises of an impressive entrance hall, four large reception rooms, a spacious family kitchen, utility room, boot room, downstairs cloakroom, a large re-fitted family bathroom and four double bedrooms with en-suite to the master and second bedroom. The property also benefits from beautiful landscaped rear gardens and an outdoor heated swimming pool.The property is entered via a large storm porch with tiled flooring and has a beautiful established wisteria growing across the façade. The impressive entrance hall has stairs to first floor and doors giving access to the reception rooms, kitchen and also to a downstairs cloakroom. To the front of the property is a dining room, currently being used as a large study, with fireplace, high ceilings and windows overlooking the front garden. The family /play room has a bay window and patio doors overlooking the swimming pool.To the rear of the entrance hall double doors give access to a family kitchen, fitted with a range of built in appliances, base and wall units light granite work surfaces over. The kitchen gives access to a large formal drawing room, a utility room, boot room and a further sitting room. The drawing room is an impressive formal space with stone fireplace and inset contemporary gas burning stove, cornice and large picture windows and doors overlooking the gardens to both the side and rear aspect. The sitting room is open plan to the kitchen and is a great family area with large windows and doors overlooking the gardens. The utility room is of a good size and is fitted with a range of base and full height units with worktops and sink, leading through a further door is a utility/boot room with laundry facilities and access door into the garage.On the first floor, the landing is split level with the lower level giving access to the guest bedroom and the galleried landing gives access to the further three bedrooms including the master and also to the large family bathroom. The guest bedroom has windows overlooking the front garden, a dressing room and en-suite shower room. The master also has a large en-suite shower room and windows overlooking the front garden. The further two bedrooms are to the side and rear of the property with one benefitting from en-suite facilities. The spacious family bathroom is fitted with a contemporary suite and has a beautiful sunken bath with granite surfaces and also inset his 'n' hers sinks.OutsideThe property is accessed via wrought iron gates onto a sweeping hard standing driveway providing parking for several vehicles. The landscaped front gardens feature shrubs, borders and mature trees, with the rear garden mainly laid to lawn with a variety of shrubs, borders, mature trees and plants, all enclosed by fencing and hedging. A large patio area houses a heated swimming pool and further seating areas.LocationThorpe Road is a popular and central location in Longthorpe, Peterborough, situated close to the City Centre which is approximately two miles away and has the main shopping district and offering a diverse range of restaurants and eateries, extensive retail opportunity, medical centre, the historic Cathedral and also with the main line train station providing fast and frequent rail links into London Kings Cross, with an advertised journey time of around 50 minutes. Ferry Meadows Country Park can be found nearby and offers walking and cycling routes, as well as extensive outdoor recreational activities such as water sports, golf courses, children's play parks and cafes. With the beautiful open rolling countryside of Cambridgeshire, Northamptonshire, Rutland and Norfolk all very accessible.1. listing.description: This beautifully refurbished home can be found on a private road that leads to the footpaths and trails that meander through the South Foreland Valley, a protected area of Special Scientific Interest around St. Margaret’s Bay, so is very quiet and peaceful. From the moment you walk through the front door into the very spacious and welcoming entrance hall, you will be mesmerised by the view. Whether you rush straight outside through one of the two sets of French doors onto the terrace to get a better look or wander through the bevelled glass doors into the light and elegant lounge with its two sets of French doors leading directly onto the terrace, bookshelves (handmade by Thoroughly Wood) and attractive fireplace, it is still the view across the countryside, white cliffs and the sea that takes your breath away. At night, in the winter, the clear skies make it an excellent spot for anyone interested in astronomy. There is a delightful open-plan feel about this lovely home as you flow through from the hall to the dining room and the sitting area to the modern bespoke kitchen and breakfast area designed by City Kitchens of Canterbury. It includes a built-in double oven, microwave and hob, integrated Miele dishwasher, fridge, freezer and washing machine while the large breakfast area also has double French doors to the terrace so you can sit here and enjoy the great outdoors. There is a large study overlooking the gardens, as well as a separate bedroom and bathroom accessed through glass doors. As the older ‘cottage’ part of the house was built at the turn of the last century and the newer extension was added circa 2002, the house has two staircases. The first leads to the master bedroom with its wall of mirrored and wood wardrobes, modern bathroom with bath, power shower and underfloor heating, as well as two superb balconies where you can sit over your morning coffee admiring the view or enjoy a nightcap watching the twinkling lights of Calais. Another double bedroom and bathroom up the second staircase provides guests or family members with their own private, en suite facilities.What the Owner says:We have lived in our lovely home for the past 10 years and spent a year completely remodelling it. Our aim has been to create a wonderful place to live, with the emphasis on a light and airy environment where most of the windows and the six sets of French doors look out onto the magnificent views of the Channel and South Foreland Valley. We wanted to make a home andnot just refurbish a house, and hope the next owners will be able to enjoy it as much as we have – whether they are looking for a permanent home or a lovely weekend and holiday retreat. St. Margaret’s is a very community-spirited village and has been home to a number of well-known celebrities. Peter Ustinov bought a small military building on the clifftop. Noel Coward owned White Cliffs, which he subsequently sold to Ian Fleming, the creator of James Bond. It is thought that Ian Fleming based his character James Bond’s code name 007 on the bus service which ran from Deal to London. There are two hotels and two public houses as well as a post office, village shop and a regular bus service to Dover, Deal and Canterbury and a wide range of societies and clubs. Residents are also able to use the St. Margaret’s resort, making use of the gym, sauna and swimming pool. You will find plenty of wonderful walks from virtually outside the front door to Kingsdown, the Dover Patrol Memorial and the SouthForeland Lighthouse – the first in the world with electric light. The hallway stairs lead down to the ground floor and beautiful open plan kitchen/family room with flexible living space which is likely to become the heart of the home with modern cream gloss kitchen, all integral appliances and French doors opening up to a patio area and individually landscaped garden. The first floor offers a 23’7 x 20’6 living room with three sets of French doors with Juliette balconies overlooking the garden.The house also offers four double bedrooms (two with en-suites and dressing rooms) one single bedroom, a study and two fully tiled family bathrooms. The master bedroom located on the top floor offers a true sense of luxurious living with 15’1 x 15’1 main room, his and hers dressing rooms, fully tiled en- suite with his and her sinks, separate shower and bath.Outside there is driveway parking for two cars, a double garage, outside storage under the main front steps and side access to a south facing enclosed rear garden.Located 0.3 of a mile away from Sunninghill high street with local amenities ranging from small independent retailers and boutiques to local cafes, bistros and delicatessens. Fees apply

Tenant Fees & Charges

Mandatory charges associated with the setting up of your tenancy

There are various fees and charges associated with renting a property that you should be aware of when considering making an offer on a property. More detailed information is available upon request.

(Where not payable you will be advised accordingly)

Preliminary Charge - 42% Inc. VAT of the first months rent or £420 Inc. VAT, whichever is the greater.
This charge all inclusive charge covers the tenancy agreement, referencing and the check-in. It is not collected until the landlord has, subject-to-contact and references, accepted your offer. If the tenancy does not proceed for whatever reason we will refund a proportionate amount of the charge based on work undertaken and costs incurred.

Short Let Fee – From £440 (Inc. VAT)†

This charge applies to short term lettings only and covers: The cost of preparing an Agreement; an inventory check-in and an end of tenancy clean (excluding carpets).

Other funds you should allow for

Payment of Intent – To be agreed with you

We may require a payment of intent as confirmation of your intent to proceed with the proposed tenancy. This will be put towards your first rental payment and will only be refunded if our client elects not to proceed. Payment of this sum does not constitute the granting of a tenancy.

Rent in Advance – 1 Month

You will usually be required to pay 1 months rent in advance.

Deposit – Equivalent to 6 weeks rent

The deposit is held to protect your landlord from you not meeting your obligations under the terms of the tenancy.

Stamp Duty Land Tax

This tax is payable on tenancies where the rent exceeds £125,000.

Charges if you terminate your tenancy Change of Sharer - £420 Inc. VAT

This charge applies when you wish to replace a named tenant with another tenant part way through your tenancy and your landlord has agreed to the change. Please note that the replacement tenant will be charged separately for referencing in the sum of £54 Inc. VAT each.

Deed of Surrender - £75 Inc. VAT

This charge applies to preparation of documentation where, at your request, the landlord has agreed to release you from the tenancy early.

Charges if you renew your tenancy

Memorandum of Renewal - £90 Inc. VAT

This charge covers the cost of preparing a basic document to confirm details of any renewal.

Renewal Tenancy Agreement - £150 Inc. VAT

This charge covers the cost of preparing a more extensive renewal document where changes to the terms agreed dictate.

Potential charges at the end of your tenancy

Future Landlord Reference - £30 Inc. VAT

This charge applies when you ask us to provide a reference to a future landlord.

† Based on a 2 bedroom property in London.
listing.description: Horton Lodge is a stunning period Riverside home of immense charm and character with many of the original hand carved oak and decorative features synonymous with the Arts & Craft era still visible.The property enjoys spectacular views over Boulters Lock and the River Thames and has the additional benefit of forming part of the Horton Grange development which sits within secureand attractive gated grounds.On entering the property from the front, a delightful reception hall with bespoke porcelain tilled flooring leads to the principle reception rooms. Leading off to the left is a charming dining room which neatly connects both the kitchen breakfast room and sitting room and sees a continuation of the flooring from the entrance hall.The contemporary styled kitchen affords a comprehensive range of storage cupboards complete with granite work surfaces. A full range of integral appliances, such as, a 'Neff' integrated dishwasher, 'Bosch' washing machine, Zanuzzi coffee machine and microwave, Britannia range double oven and wine cooler are all included in the sale price.In recent years Horton Lodge has been lovingly restored and thoughtfully extended by the current owners. This is most apparent in the magnificent sitting room, which has been designed around the dual aspect that this room enjoys. French doors open to provide access to a wrap around terrace with grey limestone paving slabs that neatly blends both indoor and outside space and is great for entertaining or relaxing. A practical cloakroom with utility cupboard completes the ground floor.Upstairs there are three generous bedrooms. Of particular note is the master bedroom suite, which benefits from the second storey of the extension and is complete with a dressing room and a lavish ensuite bathroom. The ensuite is fully tilled with travertine tiles and boasts both a free standing shower and separate roll top bath complete with an inset television. The remaining two bedrooms are serviced by an equally impressive family bathroom.SituationThe River Thames at Boulters Lock is located within 100 yards and offers delightful towpath walks to nearby villages such as Cookham & Bray. Maidenhead town centre lies approximatelytwo miles distant and offers a wide variety of shopping and recreational facilities including an indoor shopping precinct and multi screen cinema.Maidenhead's mainline station provides frequent services to London Paddington and will form part of Crossrail following completion of the works in 2019. The M4 motorway at both Junction 7 and 8/9 gives access to London and the M25 motorway network.OutsideThe house is accessed through wrought iron electrically operated gates leading to the landscaped communal grounds which are well-maintained and lie to the right of the property. In addition Horton Lodge has a private garden nestled behind a mature hedge and a bespoke hand crafted iron fence with remote access.A grey limestone paved terrace encompasses the entire house affording various entertaining and seating areas. A heated Jacuzzi is positioned in a private corner of the plot adjacent to an outsidestore complete with power and light.
listing.short_description: With spectacular views over Boulters Lock and the River Thames, a delightful three bedroom detached period property offering light and spacious accommodation throughout. The property sits within attractive gated grounds with secure parking.
listing.displayable_address: Ray Mill Road East, Maidenhead, Berkshire SL6

The recessed lighting gives the effect of a floating ceiling and this contemporary feel is echoed in the beautifully manicured shared garden.

listing.description: Preston Baker are pleased to introduce to the market this unique opportunity to acquire this spectacular five bedroom detached family home set in the heart of Doncaster. This gated property benefits from excellent road and public transport links ideal for commuters, extensive and varied local amenities and a favourable school catchment. Additionally the property benefits from its close proximity to the Town centre, Racecourse, Lakeside and Lakeside Village. Comprising of five bedrooms, two reception rooms, four bathrooms, kitchen, utility room, games room, office, extensive gardens and rear balcony this stand-alone property really has to be viewed.The property is accessed via a grand entrance door leading into the porch and in turn hallway. The vast double aspect living room includes an impressive feature fireplace and bi-folding doors leading out to the patio and garden beyond. The office/conservatory boasts views over the rear garden. The open plan kitchen dining room has a bright and spacious fell with bi-folding doors allowing light to flood the room. The high spec kitchen boasts well-appointed wall and base units, beautiful worktops and a huge range of integrated appliances; a utility room accommodates all your washing appliances. To the front of the property is the first of a number of spacious double bedrooms, this one benefiting from a modern en suite shower room.To the first floor there are four additional double bedrooms two of which boasting en suite bathrooms. The house shower room showcases a three piece suite consisting of corner shower, wash basin and toilet.Externally the property benefits from a large patio and extremely lengthy grassed garden which is surrounded by mature plant and trees. To the front is a large grassed garden and a wealth of off street parking with the use of a double garage and horse shoe drive.
listing.short_description: Preston Baker are pleased to introduce to the market this unique opportunity to acquire this spectacular five bedroom detached family home set in the heart of Doncaster. (contd...)

listing.agent_address: 7th Floor, United Kingdom House, 180 Oxford Street, London
listing.description: A 5-bedroom detached house, built in 1936 in the style of a Dutch cottage. Unique in design with a tiled 'Gambrel' roof, with low sloping eaves, the property has many of the original features in keeping with the period, whilst having been sympathetically modernised and extended. The hallway is finished in oak panelling with a solid oak 'open tread' staircase to the first floor. A second identical staircase continues from the landing to the top floor, which comprises two bright, sizable double bedrooms. On the ground floor, there are two generous reception rooms, a guest toilet and a fitted kitchen. The main reception room has a lovely integrated double glazed conservatory extension, with views over the garden. On the first floor are three double bedrooms, the main one with fitted furniture, and a large family bathroom. The garden is stocked with assorted flowers and shrubs surrounding a well-tended lawn, enclosed by timber fencing. There is a garage with its own driveway to the side.Freehold

listing.letting_fees:
Fees apply

Tenant Fees & Charges

Mandatory charges associated with the setting up of your tenancy

There are various fees and charges associated with renting a property that you should be aware of when considering making an offer on a property. More detailed information is available upon request.

(Where not payable you will be advised accordingly)

Preliminary Charge - 42% Inc. VAT of the first months rent or £420 Inc. VAT, whichever is the greater.
This charge all inclusive charge covers the tenancy agreement, referencing and the check-in. It is not collected until the landlord has, subject-to-contact and references, accepted your offer. If the tenancy does not proceed for whatever reason we will refund a proportionate amount of the charge based on work undertaken and costs incurred.

Short Let Fee – From £440 (Inc. VAT)†

This charge applies to short term lettings only and covers: The cost of preparing an Agreement; an inventory check-in and an end of tenancy clean (excluding carpets).

Other funds you should allow for

Payment of Intent – To be agreed with you

We may require a payment of intent as confirmation of your intent to proceed with the proposed tenancy. This will be put towards your first rental payment and will only be refunded if our client elects not to proceed. Payment of this sum does not constitute the granting of a tenancy.

Rent in Advance – 1 Month

You will usually be required to pay 1 months rent in advance.

Deposit – Equivalent to 6 weeks rent

The deposit is held to protect your landlord from you not meeting your obligations under the terms of the tenancy.

Stamp Duty Land Tax

This tax is payable on tenancies where the rent exceeds £125,000.

Charges if you terminate your tenancy Change of Sharer - £420 Inc. VAT

This charge applies when you wish to replace a named tenant with another tenant part way through your tenancy and your landlord has agreed to the change. Please note that the replacement tenant will be charged separately for referencing in the sum of £54 Inc. VAT each.

Deed of Surrender - £75 Inc. VAT

This charge applies to preparation of documentation where, at your request, the landlord has agreed to release you from the tenancy early.

Charges if you renew your tenancy

Memorandum of Renewal - £90 Inc. VAT

This charge covers the cost of preparing a basic document to confirm details of any renewal.

Renewal Tenancy Agreement - £150 Inc. VAT

This charge covers the cost of preparing a more extensive renewal document where changes to the terms agreed dictate.

Potential charges at the end of your tenancy

Future Landlord Reference - £30 Inc. VAT

This charge applies when you ask us to provide a reference to a future landlord.

† Based on a 2 bedroom property in London.
listing.description: This grade II listed cottage has been lovingly renovated to create a home combining character with modern living. The home is located in the popular Coleshill Village, convenient to both Amersham and Beaconsfield. The location allows the property to benefit from the use of the shops and restaurants in both towns while enjoying a rural setting. Views across fields at the rear of the plot and the tranquil garden create a wonderful stereotypical countryside getaway.Throughout the home are exposed beams injecting character into each room and solid oak wood flooring runs across the entire ground floor. The dining room provides a wonderful space for formal dining with triple aspect views of the plot. The kitchen was newly fitted when the renovation was done, incorporating various fitted appliances and units, and overlooks the garden. The sitting room offers a light space with triple aspect views of the plot and a feature wood burning stove as well as a vaulted ceiling with exposed beams. The study/bedroom 3 presents dual aspect views and an open chimney. Furthermore both the sitting room and the study/bedroom 3 provide direct access to the garden through French doors.The first floor presents two bedrooms, one of which has an en-suite, and a family bathroom. Bedroom 1 enjoys dual aspect views, a fitted cupboard and an en-suite shower room. Bedroom 2 also benefits from dual aspect views and fitted cupboards.SituationLocated in the popular village of Coleshill there are several local shops and amenities, with a greater selection available in the surrounding towns. Beaconsfield train station lies 3 miles distant providing a direct link to London Marylebone with the shortest journey taking approximately 25 minutes.OutsideThe property features a private driveway with off street parking for multiple cars in addition to a double garage fitted with units to create a utility area. The garden, although predominantly laid to lawn, features various mature trees and shrubs creating a picturesque setting. Furthermore the rear of the garden opens up to views of fields. There is a terraced area over several levels around the property providing a fantastic space for outside entertainment.
listing.short_description: Having been carefully renovated and restored in recent years, this charming Grade II listed cottage provides a wealth of character features whilst affording luxurious and versatile accommodation. The property enjoys an enviable location within this picturesque village, set in attractive grounds.

listing.description: A delightful family home partly dating back to the early 17th century, that affords a wonderful setting in grounds of 0.61 acres. The property is nestled away in the heart of a picturesque hamlet between the villages of Sarratt and Chipperfield.The accommodation offers scope for further modernisation and currently boasts three bedrooms to the first floor. These bedrooms are serviced by a well appointed bathroom situated off the main landing. The ground floor accommodation enjoys an entrance porch which leads to the dining room. The dual aspect dining room enjoys a wood burning stove and access to the sitting room and fitted kitchen. From the Kitchen you have access to the surrounding gardens and a door leading you to the utility, WC and study. The sitting room affording an open fire place and access to the side of the property completes the internal accommodation.This charming property affords a wealth of character throughout to include exposed beams, latched doors and open fireplaces.SituationSarratt enjoys a 12th Century church, shop and post office, junior school, garage and three country pubs. The Metropolitan and Chiltern Line railway services are available from both Rickmansworth & Amersham.The M25, M1 and A41 are all within a short drive.At Kings Langley there is the main line station connecting to London Euston (approx 25 minutes).    Shopping at Kings Langley provides some specialist shops to include antique shops and several restaurants, church and public house. For more extensive shopping and leisure facilities there is Watford intu Centre some six miles away.The area has a number of schools for both private and state education. Other surrounding villages also provide good local pubs and scenic village life. Rickmansworth town centre provides for more comprehensive facilities to include the food halls of Waitrose, Tesco and Marks & Spencer.OutsideA magnificent feature of the property are the extensive gardens measuring 0.61 acres which comprise of its own orchard, vegetable patch, mature trees, plants and shrubs. You also have the benefit of 1,115 sq ft of outbuildings to include a detached barn, double garage and separate work shop. The property is approached through a five bar gate to a driveway that provides plenty of parking.Additional InformationLocal Authority: Three Rivers District Council.
listing.short_description: A charming property situated on the outskirts of Sarratt village. Set in delightful grounds in excess of 0.61 acres this wonderful family home offers an abundance of character in a picturesque setting.
listing.displayable_address: Bragmans Lane, Sarratt, Rickmansworth, Hertfordshire WD3

listing.description: A beautifully presented detached house situated in a prime location, moments from Staines train station, town centre and its numerous amenities. The property provides spacious and versatile accommodation and has recently been redecorated throughout. The ground floor consists of a large entrance hall, kitchen, utility room and a open plan living/dining area. The attached annexe has a private entrance which leads to a large open plan lounge/diner with wood laminate flooring, large double bedroom, modern kitchen with built in appliances, separate utility room and a shower room. To the front of the property there is off street parking for many cars and a double garage whilst the rear garden, although shared with the main house, does have its very own patio area. Viewings are highly advised and are strictly by appointment.• Close to town centre• Within walking distance to train station• Double Garage• Parking for several cars• Investment/development potential (stpp)• Self contained Annexe

Double glazed windows to side and rear, fitted wall and base units with roll edge work tops, gas hub, under hung sink with mixer taps, breakfast bar, tiled floor.Ground floor WC    Double glazed window to side, low level WC, wall mounted basin, lino floor.Landing    Fitted carpet, double glazed window to front, radiator.Bedroom 1 17'10" x 15'2" (5.44m x 4.62m). 2nd floor, double glazed French doors to balcony, double glazed Velux to side, fitted carpet, radiator, access to storage.En suite 5'7" x 8'11" (1.7m x 2.72m). listing.description: An imposing and substantial attached Grade II listed period home centrally located in Balls Green, in between the market towns of Nailsworth & Minchinhampton. The present owners have lovingly restored this important local residence. Their aim was to renovate the period features at the same time as upgrading the facilities to a higher and more comfortable standard. The various works carried out have helped to create a fabulous family home. The official listing dates the property to the early 19th Century. Even though Balls Green House is attached to its neighbour, it very much feels like a detached property. As you will see from the floor plan, the layout of the comprehensive accommodation is found over four levels with a central staircase. Upon entering the property, you are met with a beautiful entrance hall with access to both of the principal reception rooms and the kitchen. The drawing room benefits from access out to the garden. On the lower ground floor you will find a 29' basement/games room with access to a utility room, a study and a useful store room. You can also access the garden from this floor. The bedrooms are located on the first and second floors. Bedrooms one and two enjoy a 'Jack and Jill' bathroom. On the second floor you will find two further bedrooms and a bathroom, with two more bedrooms accessed by separate staircases. Two further rooms offer extra living space with one room leading out to the rear garden. Property Ref: STR150246.SituationBalls Green is a small collection of homes lying in an elevated rural position just outside Minchinhampton. Minchinhampton has a range of independent amenities including a delicatessen, butcher, chemist, cafés, tea room, restaurant, an organic dairy, a useful small supermarket, doctors’ surgery, library, primary school, two churches and further facilities. The property is situated on an escarpment position enjoying beautiful views over the surrounding Cotswold valley. The house faces south west and the garden enjoys the afternoon sun. The nearby market town of Nailsworth offers a wider selection of shops, bars and amenities with both Stroud and Cirencester also being within reach. The communication links are also excellent with Stroud and Kemble Stations offering high-speed train links to London Paddington in under 90 minutes and the A419 linking through to the M4 either at Junction 18 for Bath or Junction 17 for Malmesbury. Schooling is also a big pull for this area with both Wycliffe College and Beaudesert Park School being popular choices for local families. The area also has two grammar schools, and Minchinhampton itself offers excellent primary education.OutsideThe gardens are situated to the side and rear of the property. A shared driveway leads past the neighbouring property up to a private gravelled parking area, offering parking for several vehicles. The property contains a detached garage with a substantial store room above. The extensive grounds are quite exceptional & will be any gardener’s dream. Mainly laid to lawn with an abundance of trees, shrubs, roses & hedging, the majority of the garden is completely private and is partly enclosed by Cotswold stone walls. The garden enjoys views over a neighbouring field, which is owned and managed by the Gloucestershire Wildlife Trust.
listing.short_description: An imposing and substantial 6 bedroom attached Grade II listed country home centrally located in Balls Green, close to the market towns of Minchinhampton and Nailsworth. Parking and detached garage. 3999 sq ft of accommodation. All set in 0.56 of an acre.

listing.description: Summary  Occupying a prime location in this busy Cotswolds town, a freehold retail/residential investment offering tremendous development potential.The ground floor retail unit extends to approximately 1400 sq ft and comprises of a large shop with extensive storage providing an opportunity to extend the existing retail space if required.To the first and second floor is a good quality duplex apartment comprising; living room, dining room/bedroom three, study area, bedroom, bathroom & shower room and a kitchen/breakfast room.To the second floor is a further bedroom and dressing room.Outside the apartment enjoys lovely private gardens and benefits from off road parking accessed via an electric gate off Church Lane.Location  Burford is traditionally known as the 'Gateway to the Cotswolds' An area of outstanding natural beauty protected by the Cotswold Conservation Board. Burford itself has a broad main high street lined with old houses cottages and shops which appear not to have changed for hundreds of years. The town is situated just off the A40,19 miles from Oxford, 29 miles from Gloucester and 75 miles from London.The town offers good facilities including a comprehensive school, primary school, medical surgery, library, numerous public houses and a variety of shops.Planning  Planning was granted on the 7th June 2012 (12/0890/P/fp)"Erection of dwelling and detached carport with studio/storage above, internal alterations to flat and storage area to shop"

listing.letting_fees:
If you choose to rent a property through Gibson Lane we will require the following:
Before the start of the tenancy a deposit equivalent to six weeks rent (calculated by dividing the annual rent by 52 and multiplying by 6), in addition to the first months rent and the tenancy agreement fee must be paid. This is subject to contract and referencing, a landlord may require a higher deposit, rent in advance or a guarantor if the referencing criteria is not met or if you have pets, further details will be provided at that time.

Application Fee:

£500 per Tenancy.

The application fee is deducted from the final amount you pay when you move in.

Reference and Administration Fee:

£100 + VAT (£120.00) per applicant.

All applicants named on the tenancy agreement must be referenced.

Should your income (combined income for joint tenants) not meet 2.5 x the annual rent you will be required to provide a guarantor or pay rent in advance for the full term of the tenancy. Guarantors are required to complete the referencing process and must have an income of 2.5 x the annual rent.

Guarantor Reference and Administration Fee:

£100 + VAT (£120.00) per guarantor.

You should be aware that the need for a Guarantor may not become apparent until your referencing, (including for any joint tenants) has been completed, therefore guarantor referencing fee(s) will only become payable should a guarantor be required.

Tenancy Agreement Fee:

£150 + VAT (£180.00)

One off charge for the Tenancy Agreement preparation.

Renewal/Extension agreements:

£100 + VAT (£120.00)

One off charge for each renewal/extension.

Inventory Fees:

Inventory Check In/Out fees as per the Tenancy Agreement. In most circumstances the Landlord will cover the costs of the inventory and check in and the tenant will pay for the check out. The check out fee is usually deducted from the tenants deposit at the end of the tenancy. These fees are variable depending on the size of the property and the duration of the Tenancy and starts from £160 + VAT. Please feel free to contact this office for a price on a particular property or for more information on any charges.

Please note:

If you withdraw from the proposed tenancy for any reason we will retain your application fee and any additional fees you have paid.

listing.description: Handsome detached 3/4 bedroom farmhouse with three substantial outbuildings set in 17.25 acres in a wonderful rural location with far reaching views.The farm is all about position. The property sits in an elevated site nestled in some outstanding rolling countryside in a peaceful rural location yet within two miles of Bridport town. The house itself is a classic doubled fronted farmhouse which has the potential, as it is not listed, to be substantially extended or remodelled to take in the outhouse/cottage behind. At present the house has three bedrooms and a shower room upstairs and downstairs a sitting room, a dining room, a kitchen and a fourth bedroom served by a family bathroom. Across from the farmhouse there is a substantial stone and block Barn while on the west side there is a large four bay agricultural barn. On three sides of the house the land stretches out from the property and is laid to pasture enclosed by post & wire fencing and hedge from which far-reaching views can be enjoyed.

listing.description: Greenhill is a 1920’s detached family home having undergone significant extension and improvement offering versatile and well planned living accommodation yet still retaining much of the original charm and character. Overall there is in excess of 3000 sq. Ft. Of accommodation which comprises entrance hall with natural wood flooring, exposed beams and natural elm staircase and undoubtedly one of the features of the property is the 30ft x 17ft kitchen/dining room with a Mark Wilkinson fitted kitchen area with a range of fitted and free standing appliances, granite work surfaces and oak breakfast bar, all complemented by natural stone flooring. From the kitchen there is a fantastic view of the garden through the full width bi folding doors. The dual aspect living room also benefits from bi folding doors, feature fireplace and oak flooring and three further reception rooms, a utility room and cloakroom round off the ground floor accommodation. To the first there are five double bedrooms with the master bedroom being to the rear with dual aspect windows, large walk in dressing room and en suite. The front aspect guest bedroom also has an en suite shower and there is a luxury family bathroom. The property also benefits from radiator central heating and double glazed windows throughout and is offered with no onward chain complications.LocationThe property is conveniently located for the commuter with the M3 and M4 motorways easily accessible and trains from Crowthorne station to Reading, Guildford and beyond. Local shops serve everyday needs well and more comprehensive facilities are available nearby at Camberley, The Meadows and Wokingham. Schooling is well served both by state and public schools most notable amongst them Wellington College, Eagle House and Yateley Manor. The property is also close to East Berkshire Golf Club and further leisure facilities can be found at Wellington College.OutsideThe property is approached to the front via a five bar gate with extensive off road parking which leads to the adjoining single garage. To the rear of the property there is a raised timber decking area providing extensive outside seating and dining space with steps down to the formal garden which is laid mainly to lawn with established flower and shrub borders and enclosed by mature hedging. At the rear of the formal garden is a further open plan area ideal for young children with a timber fort and large area for trampoline, football, swings and slide etc.SituationA beautiful five bedroom 1920’s detached family home with four reception rooms and a good sized garden on the outskirts of this sought after Berkshire village.

listing.description: St George Wharf is a landmark riverside development spanning across 7 acres of London's hottest area of regeneration, and conveniently, just moments from London's Vauxhall Underground Station. Initially rising 22 storeys but now with the addition of the 48 storey Tower, the tallest sole residential building in the UK, St George Wharf is a focal point of the South Bank. The main development is easily identifiable by its gull-wing roofs and stylish terraces; Broadway Malyan Architects had a willingness to champion innovation and as such have designed an original and expressive building with a fantastic attention to detail. Riverside living does not get much better than this.Residents of this SW8 development, St George Wharf, often comment on its sense of community, with a stunning series of landscaped courtyards and elegant fountains creating an idyllic rural atmosphere in the heart of central London. St George Wharf combines this serene courtyard with state of the art facilities; amenities include a supermarket, restaurant and bar, an nhs Doctors, dentist, a 24hr gymnasium and a spa offering a wide variety of treatments.In keeping with the green ethos of the development, the newly completed Tower will require one third of the energy currently used by similar buildings. Specifically, One, The Tower will house a wind turbine to power common lighting areas and a London Aquifer (complete with heat pump technology) to extract warmth from water to heat apartments during the winter. Triple-glazed windows throughout minimise heat loss in winter whilst ventilated blinds between the glazing protects apartments from heat through direct sunlight.Not only is St George Wharf a peaceful environment in the heart of the capital, it's also a safe one. With apartments accessible to a 24 hour concierge service, CCTV and a video entry system into each property, safety and security in the development was paramount in the developer's approach.Apartments vary from studios to luxury 5 bedroom penthouses, all finished to the highest specification. The breath-taking river views and fantastic transport links ensure St George Wharf is the best of both worlds in terms of luxury and necessity. With Vauxhall Underground Station right on your doorstep Victoria, Green Park and Oxford Circus stations are all just minutes away. The nearby Vauxhall Rail Station means areas such as Waterloo and Clapham Junction are also easily accessible.
listing.short_description: Montgomery & Slate are proud to present this stunning studio apartment in The Tower, St George Wharf situated in the sought after Vauxhall SW8. This stunning development is beside the Vauxhall bridge and MI6's headquarter.
listing.displayable_address: The Tower, One St George Wharf, Vauxhall SW8

listing.description: A characterful, well-kept five bedroom detached house, built in 1936 in the style of a Dutch cottage. Unique in design with a tiled 'Gambrel' roof, with low sloping eaves, the property has many of the original features in keeping with the period, whilst having been sympathetically modernised and extended by the present owners. The fabulous hallway is finished in oak panelling with a solid oak 'open tread' staircase to the first floor. A second identical staircase continues from the landing to the top floor, which comprises two bright, sizable double bedrooms. On the ground floor, there are two generous reception rooms, a guest toilet and a fitted kitchen. The main reception room has a lovely integrated double glazed conservatory extension, with views over the garden. On the first floor are three double bedrooms, the main one with fitted furniture, and a large family bathroom. The garden is stocked with assorted flowers and shrubs surrounding a well-tended lawn, enclosed by timber fencing. There is a garage with its own driveway to the side. A very pleasant location on a quiet road, only a short walk from the delightful Friary Park and North Middlesex Golf Course, with good transport connections, popular local schools and an array of shops, eateries and restaurants available on North Finchley High Road.
listing.short_description: A characterful, well-kept five bedroom detached house, built in 1936 in the style of a Dutch cottage. (contd...)

listing.description: The Property Partnership are delighted to offer this wonderfully characterful and well-presented two double bedroom Victorian house with significant potential to extend (stpp), ideally situated within the heart of Little Chelsea, and just moments from the river Thames and shops and restaurants of eclectic White Hart Lane.The ground floor comprises a lovely double reception with original wooden flooring, as well as a good size kitchen, providing access to a pretty and very private courtyard garden. Upstairs the full-width master bedroom contains built-in wardrobes, with a further double bedroom, and spacious bathroom completing the accommodation.This charming house offers the potential to extend both at ground and second-floor level, subject to necessary permissions. It is perfectly placed to enjoy the relaxed yet vibrant White Hart Lane community, with its excellent schools, transport links and restaurants, the latter including Rick Stein's first London venture, overlooking the river from Tideway Yard.

listing.description: Offered to the open market for the first time in over 50 years is this four bedroom, two reception room, end of terraced property with integrated garage, off-road parking, enclosed rear garden and potential to extend into the loft to create well proportioned, family living in a cul-de-sac location.The property is ideally located for West Ealing railway station (Crossrail), approximately a five minute level walk, with Ealing Broadway Underground station approximately 0.8 miles.The property does require modernisation but in our opinion this offers an exceptional opportunity to create a substantial, family home. The house benefits from vacant possession and viewings are highly recommended in order to fully appreciate the potential that this opportunity affords.The ground floor has a sitting room to the front of the property, large reception to the rear with patio doors to garden. Good sized kitchen with a range of high and low units leading into a utility area with door to rear garden and a downstairs WC.The integrated garage has the potential to be converted to provide a third reception room.The first floor has the main bedroom with fitted wardrobes and three further bedrooms. Main bathroom with a three piece bathroom suite. Access to the loft is by ladder and the loft is fully boarded with velux style window. There is potential to extend into the loft space stpp.Outside the rear garden has a patio area and graveled area with a range of mature shrubs. listing.description: An exceptionally well presented four double bedroom contemporary house having been extensively upgraded by its current owners. The property boasts spacious accommodation arranged over three floors benefiting from open plan living with private south facing terrace, en-suite to master bedroom and bedroom two. Large garage with utility at rear. Lilliput and Baden Powell School Catchment.The AreaNo 2 Point South is located in the heart of Lilliput in one of the area's premier roads, and within a short level walk to local shops.Close by is the renowned Salterns Marina offering superb boating facilities and the Blue Flag beaches of Sandbanks. At the end of Sandbanks Peninsula is the chain link ferry giving vehicular and pedestrian access to the many miles of National Heritage coastline of the Isle of Purbeck.Lilliput is ideally located for those needing travel connections to London, the rest of Europe and beyond. London Waterloo can be reached in under two hours via train and road and Bournemouth International Airport offers both internal and international flights to a variety of destinations.The PropertyPoint South is a stunning development of three houses which nestle into the landscape of this popular residential area, which enjoys a rich and diverse array of amenities. No.2 is an ideal house for those wishing to enjoy substantial accommodation, whether as a family, or for oneself. The immediate proximity of the local golf course, marinas, beaches and salubrious village locations makes this an ideal home, whether as a main property or a 'lock up and leave' easy to maintain second residence.The spacious accommodation is arranged over three floors and comprises four double bedrooms, of which two are en suite. A further family bathroom serves the remaining bedrooms and there is a conveniently placed ground floor shower room on the entrance level. The principal accommodation is mainly open plan and opens onto a level and well maintained rear garden, which is a good size and offers a secure area for children and dogs.
